name: superfecundation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a situation in which two or more of a female's eggs are fertilized (= caused to start to develop) by different males: Although extremely rare in humans, superfecundation is common in dogs, cats, and cows. Superfecundation is most likely to occur in town and city cats.
More examplesFewer examplesIf female cats were not so sexually voracious, superfecundation would also be far less common.Superfecundation happens when two or more of a woman's eggs are fertilized by different men during the same ovulation period.
